question_text: What makes containerized applications more portable than traditional virtual machines?
answer_options: They are embedded into the host BIOS
They package the full operating system for migration
They are self-contained and exclude the OS, reducing size and complexity
They use virtualization extensions in CPU hardware
correct_answer: They are self-contained and exclude the OS, reducing size and complexity
